Reviews.Title: “Good location but otherwise just OK”
Reviews.Author: PK18
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. It's minutes from the main terminal station and everything is walkable from this hotel. We walked to Trevi, Colosseum, Pantheon and many restaurants and gelato places! The room was small but that is expected for hotels in Europe. The washroom was also tiny but overall the room was clean and we felt safe. The downsides - the wifi was awful and rarely every worked. They had computers available in the lobby which were free to use but two out of the four did not work which meant waiting for long periods of time to get online. Note: they do not have a business centre so we were unable to print out tour vouchers or our boarding passes. The other downside was the front desk - they were not helpful at all and very rude! We asked for recommendations for restaurants, we inquired about one of tours and each time they could not help us! Many of the individuals working at the front desk did not speak english which made it difficult to even communicate at times. Overall, we thought the hotel was ok but I would not come back here strictly based on the service we received at the front desk. In my opinion, the front desk should be helpful, knowledgeable and friendly....at this hotel, they were none of the above! Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel near termini”
Reviews.Author: sailor222
Reviews.Content: Twin room that they gave to us was rather small and window opening to inner garden. Breakfast hall was very small and with limited choice.will try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: sg09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days.Hotel is quite close to Roma Termini and rooms are nice.Breakfast was also fine but the only problem is that front desk staff appears a little snobbyish.They are professional but never smile..which is a little annoying at times and you feel unwelcomed..

Reviews.Title: “Staff need to change their attitude...”
Reviews.Author: sawadee_1
Reviews.Content: This place was OK, not the best, but cheap, €85 per night, near enough to walk from Termini station ( central Rome station) but the biggest downfall is the staff, on arrival the reception guy seems to be annoyed with everyone, I walked in to see him, flicking through a Japanese passport... Wanted my passport, I said I've already paid you for the room, no need for it... Seemed to work, no welcome, key handed to you then left to your own devices. Hmmm excuse me, where is the room, " waved in the direction of the elevator" Nice.... Was pretty sick so spent all day in the room, room was basic, very basic, old 1990 type TV, BAHROOM AND SHOWER.... crap.... Breakfast...took me 30 seconds to walk through the breakfast lounge to realise, I'm checking out and will eat elsewhere.... I like a decent breakfast in the morning, don't we all?? Not the shiite they had on the tables.. Can't recommend and wouldn't return....

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, would use again.”
Reviews.Author: debdoes
Reviews.Content: Recently returned after travelling with Gullivers Sport Tours for the Six Nations Eng v Italy Six Nations game. We had a suite with bedroom, shower room and small dressing/TV room. Smallish rooms, but tall and not oppressive. Very clean, spotless bedding, changed every day. Shampoo etc, lots of towels. Luckily there was a heated ladder towel rail in the shower room as well as the air conditioning as we got soaked and snowed-on during our trip, and we could dry our coats quickly. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast and bar service good, but bar shuts at 10.30 - not what you want on a rugby tour. Having said that there are bars and restaurants all around the area, so you only have to walk a short way. Maybe it's best for the other guests who are not rugby fans to have a peaceful place for a quite drink. The hotel is only 5 mins walk from the Termini station and we got the train from there to the airport on leaving as we extended our stay by a day and the rest of the party resturned by coach on Sunday. The ticket machines were easy to use at the station, with commentary in English, and two tickets to the airport cost E28. We also had a 48-hour 'hop-on-hop-off' bus tour, paid in advance, to get our bearings, meaning to use it on the following day to get between sites and the Olympic Stadium. However, due to the snow the bus didn't run, so that was a bit of a waste of money. Not their fault though. We walked on average 10-12 miles per day, and saw all the main sites, but did not go into the Vatican or the Collesseum. We did, however, visit the church of St Clement, which has a beautiful church built on top of a 4th century church, which is built on top of a 1st century building which was used to celebrate the pagan Mithras. There is also a Romas house underground and you can visit it all for E5. All in all a very good trip, even though freezing - and we won!

Reviews.Title: “Would come again”
Reviews.Author: Asemi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 days and 3 nights here for the new year. It is a pretty place, with a kind and helpful staff who know multiple languages and they are there 24 hours. The room we stayed in was a good size, and clean. The continental breakfast is decent. It is located within walking distance to the Colesseum, Forum, Pantheon,and Trevi Fountain. The metro is about a 5 minute walk and pretty easy to use. I would recommend this hotel, and come again. Also, since we were here for the new year, the hotel hosted a small gathering on the roof top terrace to see the fireworks from all around the city. My only complaint would be the shower. The pressure is terrible, and it goes from hot to cold often.

Reviews.Title: “Nord Nuova Roma”
Reviews.Author: krrnadam
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome and stayed in Nord Nuova Roma Hotel twice (in October and November). The hotel is located close to Termini station, underground (Piazza Repubblica) and local bus station – 5-10 minutes’ walk. Both rooms I occupied (single) were small and rather cold. The hotel provides Italian-style breakfasts – I don’t recommend them. On the other hand, free wi-fi is provided (ask for your individual internet password in the reception).

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Rome, the historic city”
Reviews.Author: nkladakhi
Reviews.Content: Plus. Conviniently located at 100 mtrs (5 minutes walk) from the Roma Termini station and 75 mtrs from the Metro station/tram station/ city tour bus stop.Useful specially if you have heavy luggage and have to tow it yourself. 24 hour Reception available useful especially if you are arriving late. Staff is very courteous and polite. Lift available for carrying luggage with bellboy so you need not worry about luggage on reaching the hotel. Room service available for morning tea. Milk for small children available and they allow you to give your own purchased milk and return it back after warming, important especially if you are with small children. Lot of variety available for breakfast so reach in time and fill your stomach before you start your day. Daily cleaning of laundry and room maintainence done. Spacious rooms with AC and TV available with channels to suit all ages. Place to keep luggage at a later time after checkout exists if you are leaving at the later part of the day. Reservation at a short notice available. Free internet in the Common area near the reception, passwords to be collected from the reception on request. Minus. Kitchen and room staff mostly understands Italian and little English, so takes an effort to explain. Need to specify what you want with tea and clarify as to what is complementary. Slightly expensive but then the facilities available give good value for money. Italian Keyboard, so those used to the US ones beware to take help in advance from a helping staff member/other guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ceramacist
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the internet and it was a great choice. It is very handy to the railway station and the main bus departures. It is one street back from the railway station so misses all the traffic but it only takes 5 minutes to get to the station. Very good front desk and rooms are very clean and spacious. A good buffet breakfast is available and after a days sightseeing it is great to retire to the bar on the roof and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Horrible”
Reviews.Author: blackrose59
Reviews.Content: Do not even think about this one. The staff was annoyed as we walked in the hotel. Heaven help you if you needed assistance. My room on the 6th floor had an odor of a cesspool coming from the drains on the floor and shower. @ of our large group had a luggage piece stolen from their lobby as well. My toiletr did not flush about midnight. I called the desk and an employee came, saw the problem, shrugged his shoulders and siad tomorrow and left the room. To be fair it was clean and they let you use their internet in the lobby. Not worth the bother.

Reviews.Title: “One rude place”
Reviews.Author: Cexaxigo
Reviews.Content: We were here with a group on October 9 . When a backpack was stolen from the lobby the desk staff never helped us. They were very rude and did not care. This was their everyday attitude. There is no security cameras there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, convenient & serviceable!”
Reviews.Author: KDVS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3 nights. It is one block from the central train station ("Terminale") so very convenient to the subway and taxi stands, sights, etc. The staff all speak very good English. The front desk was as helpful as one could ever hope. The rooms were very nice & clean, our bathroom was large and very nicely equipped. The continental breakfast had a wide variety of delicious foods, nothing gourmet, but very nice. We hope to stay here again someday! (The beds are extra firm, but we found that throughout France and Italy.)

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Worktravel01
Reviews.Content: I really cant imagine why anyone would review this hotel with even three stars. There are so many better options in Rome in nicer areas with better rooms and for a cheaper price. I decided to stay here for the night as I had an early flight out the following morning. Unfortunately I was virtually unable to sleep as there was a lot of corridor noise and external noise. The staff arent unfriendly but certainly dont offer any information re breakfast times etc. The rooms are certainly very clean which is a positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rooner30
Reviews.Content: THe Hotel Nord Nuova Roma provided, just around the corner from the major transportation hub, provided excellent room accomodations and service. It's buffet breakfast is among the best we have ever had. The rooftop restaurant is romantic and reasonable in price and offers a great view of the city. We'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was just fine”
Reviews.Author: kacpara
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, rooms are clean, air conditioning is fine... Breakfast is good and rich. Concerning the internet, if you're lucky, you'll 'catch' a free computer. However, most of the time they're occupied (probably our bad timing - mornings/evenings). Staff is OK - do not have much experience. May be they could just tell us a bit more info upon arrival - e.g. where and when the breakfast is served etc., just the basic ones... Overall impression is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BigTed-Tiny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just in Rome for a 4 day stay having travelled down by train. This hotel is literally five minutes walk from the Termini in Rome. The rooms are good and comfortable it can be noisy outside at 06.00 but we are in a capital city. The staff are superbly helpful in everything from extra pillows, organising transport and general directions. The breakfast is excellent and varied. Basically we are enjoying our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic Roman hotel, but not in summer!”
Reviews.Author: Julie1952
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is a mere 1.5 blocks from the Termini train station, so you can cut an expensive taxi ride to and from your train transportation out of your Roman budget! We found the desk staff to be helpful, showing us on maps where the locations we wanted to walk to were located. If walking all over Rome hasn't diminished your energy, the hotel boasts a great little minigym as well. The rooms were small but adequate, however the air conditioning is a joke. Kept it on full blast for the 3 sweltering September days we were there and finally the last day the room was cool enough to sleep in. The only concession to heat relief was the delightful roof garden overlooking parts of the city with the bar serving drinks and snacks. A very Roman way to end the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: GrandMaX85
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the Nord Nuova. I felt very comfortable. The internet in the rom was not easy to get (signal), but the lobby computers were always available. The breakfast was good to start the day!! The personnel was pleasant...no complaints. The terrace was peaceful and inviting. Close to the Termini and bus station...good location. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to everything but bad receptionists”
Reviews.Author: Svendsen-Jensen
Reviews.Content: Position The hotel is very close to many of the interesting places in Rome. Close to the Termini station and the Metro. Nice neighborhood. The room were nice and comfortable. Reception: The staff at the reception were ignorants an arrogant. They didn't welcome you looking at you. Nor did they welcome you at all. They ignored you when you Came to the counter although they sometimes were 3 in the reception. They pretended to do very important stuff so the guest (the customer) off course had to wait. When we checked out the receptionist said: "checkout?" - "anything from the mini-bar?" - "visa or cash" - And then we got a receipt and no more like "Thank you for staying....." or "have a good day..." - Just nothing! Who pays their salary? WI-F: One of the reasons for booking the hotel were "Free internet access - WIFI". You had to be in a specific place in your room to get access. The first two days we had to get new passwords every day at the reception until they gave us for a week. Why not give us that from the beginning? No internet at the terrace either. Breakfast: Ok breakfast. Different types of bread, fruit, youghurt and cakes. Nice to start the day like this and the staff were very nice! Roomservice: Ok but they forgot us one day.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: domtcreg
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for one night in Rome, before we took off for Venice and I am so glad we choice this Hotel. The room was just what we needed and had no complaints. After a quick check in we took showers and needed something to quench our famished bodies. After asking the clerk at the reception he recommended a restaurant two blocks away, which was our first meal in Italy. I was so glad for the recommendation because our first meal in Italy was just what we expected and more. Since we needed to leave for Venice early the next morning the location of Bettoja was perfect since we only had to walk 2 blocks with our luggage to Roma Termini to catch our train. Wifi service was also extremely easy, just ask for the username and pass code from the reception!

Reviews.Title: “Still the best after 10 years”
Reviews.Author: Angelika40
Reviews.Content: We were there 10 years ago and went back this year again while touring Europe. The hotel is nice, clean, the staff is very friendly, excellent location and a very good breakfast. The room was comfortable and quite, very clean sheets. We hope we don't have to wait another 10 years to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent staff and second-rate accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Xamb
Reviews.Content: My experience was exactly the same as the previous reviewer (psiklas). The reputed free Wi-Fi did not reach my room, and internet connection was non-existent, to which the staff of the hotel responded, "use the computer in the lobby." The rooms are not horrible, but not very comfortable or efficiently designed/refurbished, either. The layout of the hotel is confusing. It is near a number of sights and restaurants, but like the previous reviewer, it was not as convenient to key points or public transport as I would have preferred. With so many helpful, outgoing Italians at every other establishment, how is it that this hotel couldn't find any to work at the front desk?

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect for train station - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: TCLP2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first visit to Rome and were able to find it quickly and easily after leaving Termini. The room and bathroom were clean, the internet worked, and they had a lovely rooftop area! The breakfast in the morning was in a large room and had plenty of options to get your day started - the usual pastries, yogurt, coffee, cereal we saw throughout our Italy trip. We walked everywhere while in Rome from this location. The only mode of transportation we used was the Metro once to make it to the Vatican tour on time. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We would never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: pkislas
Reviews.Content: The hotel front desk staff was nothing short of rude. They were not helpful with typical questions regarding directions, restaurants, etc. We attempted to use the internet service in our room, but only able to connect twice for a few short minutes. The staff did nothing to assist us except to suggest using their shared computers in the lobby. The room was clean and large enough for our needs. The cleaning staff was very helpful and professional. Breakfast was o.k. Location was o.k. If you've never been to Rome before you might think the location was great, but we stayed near the Trevi Fountain at the end of our trip and loved that location. Everything was within walking distance. Not the case with this hotel which made it a little difficult visiting many of the attractions. Overall it was an o.k. stay except for the staff and mediocre location. We would not stay there again or recommend the hotel to anyone planning a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice For a Family of Three”
Reviews.Author: mkgssong
Reviews.Content: Bettoja Hotel Nord Nuova Roma was the perfect choice for our family of 3, perfect location, perfect for our budget. Traveling to a new country can be a bit daunting, having a good homebase to settle into is vital, and the Hotel Nord provided that beautifully. Trust the pictures on their homepage, the hotel is exactly what you see. The location is safe, close to the Metro, and TerminiTrain Station so it is very convienient. There are several local eateries within minutes of walking, safe at night to walk to and enjoy accordian music ( always with lingering musicans looking for token change for their musical numbers), and delicious meals. The front desk people are very kind and helpful and speak English..a plus. I was a bit nervous after booking, I shouldn't have been. The rooms are nice, very clean and comfortable, breakfast was good and had many choices, and pretty much the standard selections that you will find in a complimentary hotel breakfast. The Republica is literally a short block away and the Metro stop is right there. From this stop ( 1 Euro) you can drop yourself off by the Vatican, around the corner from the Spanish Steps, or close to the Trevi Fountain. You can walk over to the Termini Station and catch the "B" line to the Colossuem, so the hotel location is great. I do understand that all rooms are not indentical, but I did not hear anyone complain while I was there about a problem and we spent 4 nights. The Terrace is lovely in the evening and a nice place to enjoy a glass of wine before retiring for the evening. I would stay here again...easy choice. I hope this helps..oh and I have pictures ;)

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DaniSan
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel following the recommendation of a close friend, I was a bit worry as I was travelling with a toddler but overall the hotel meet our expectations. The good: The room was pretty big and clean, elevator perfect for a family with stroller, location is only 5 minutes walk from Termini, we never used a taxi during our whole stay, breakfast was really nice and healthy, dont expect the standard bacon and scramble eggs but nice ham, hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee, cereal, bread, etc. and finally the free WiFi in the lobby, it was hard to get signal in our room but worked a few times. The bad: Shower was very small, the walls are very thin we could hear everything outside and in the corridors all night long, the first night our AC was not working and the staff was very rude with us, they did offer to change us to another room but it was super small and not suitable for us with our toddler. Overall this is a nice small hotel with a great location but I think the next time I will try one of the hotels in Via Nationale.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Bettoja Hotel Nord Nuova Roma”
Reviews.Author: rome066
Reviews.Content: We went on vacation at Rome and we chose a good , central hotel . The most important factor for me is to have a good hotel with a safety deposit box after hearing of all the pickpockets being everywhere. We got a big room for 4 people . The room was clean . Washroom also was clean. Breakfast was okay overall but i was very deceived and surprised that a big amount of our money got stolen on our second day of our trip . They do not wait long to sneak and take whatever they can . It does not matter whether you secure your money in the safety deposit box in your room as if they want to take your money they will definitely find a way to do so . We complain with the manager but of course he will deny everything . I would prefer that i was pick pocketed rather than being stolen in my room hotel specially after having secured my money in the safety deposit box...... Ciao for ever Roma - never again will i visit Rome after this awful experience ....... Also , they speak very poor English . Do not let yourself be fooled when people say Italians speak good English .... Internet sucks too - very very slow if you want to use your laptop in your room

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jason1051
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nord is located two block from the Termini train station which works out well when visiting multiple cities in Italy. Free breakfast including some hot food like eggs and sausage. Nice roof top bar. Friendly staff. A three star equivalent in the US but a four star by Europe standards. Bed was kind of hard but they all are in Europe from my experience. Recommended for great location and free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: suki968
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights ,we wanted to be close to the Railway Station for our journey onward to Milan.(five minute walk to Station) This was our second stay at this hotel , we were happy with it two years ago, we think that this time we got a smaller room and the En suite just had a shower not a bath like last time. The room was very clean and comfortable. The Breakfasts were good but the Staff in the Breakfast room seemed a little rude. eg, you needed to move out of the way of them if they wished to pass by and a lot of general chit chat amongst themselves, as if the guests weren't there. All other staff perfectly pleasant. Roof Top Bar worth a visit. Actually saw The Pope by mistake who was visiting a Local Church !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: kristymccray
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome for the first time, traveling with a girlfriend. As two young women, we worried about safety as we traveled in a country where neither of us knew the language. Staying at this hotel was a great choice. It was centrally located to many attractions (we only once took the subway, and walked everywhere else to/from the hotel). It's also located near the train station, which is convenient for many (we flew). There are many restaurants and shops in this neighborhood, and we felt comfortable walking alone at night. Additionally, the staff was professional, knew quite a bit of English,and were friendly. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and attractive. In choosing a room, my friend was concerned about safety--break-ins, or feeling like a "skeevy" hotel staff would take from our room, and we definitely felt safe leaving valuables here. The hotel's rooftop patio bar was gorgeous, with views of the city and lots of flowers, a wonderful environment, especially at sunset. Included with the price of our room was breakfast each morning, which was plentiful in choices and food. Overall, a GREAT, exceptional experience, we would both come back here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Worst tech amenities ever, otherwise somewhat ok”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Meteora
Reviews.Content: There's no denying the awesome location and the cleanliness but the price-quality ratio is to be debated. Depends on what your requirements are, but if you are fond of working internet connection, fresh morning cappuccino or more than one international tv channel, this is not your choice. We stayed for four nights in a triple room which consisted of two twin beds and a good size sofa bed. The room was outdated but decent size. It had a desk, a wobbly two door wardrobe, two nightstands, a minibar and a small TV. The only non-Italian channel we had was CNN with poor picture quality. The bathroom was spacious. However the shower was tiny with the shower curtain clinging to your body. By far the worst thing was the so-called internet connection. It is wireless but we could not log on with more than one device at a time and it is very slow. From the front desk you get a printed paper with a username and a password on it which allows you to use the internet for 24h from the first login. Every day you had to get new usernames and passwords which you had to insert every time you wanted to access the internet, they could not be saved in any way. Some of the passwords worked just once and after fifteen minutes of surfing it lost the connection and refused the password was supposed to work for 24h and you had to run downstairs to ask for a new piece of paper. In the lobby they had three computers which also needed the login which was good for one hour at a time. When it was time to charge the camera battery we found that the room had only three inconveniently placed sockets: one in the bathroom, one behind the desk for the TV and one behind the other nightstand by the floor. You had to choose whether to have the TV or desk light on with the desk socket. The room was very clean and nothing was stolen. However all towels and soaps were changed every day no matter where you had placed them. Seemed very unnecessary. Even though our window faced the street with a construction underway soundproofing worked and we got a good nights sleep every night. Sounds from other rooms could be heard though, but not badly. Airconditioning wasn't working all the time, there was some problem with the controls. We had to contact the reception four times before it was somewhat fixed. The breakfast was ok, no fresh fruit or vegetables (e.g. cucumber or tomato) though. Three different juices, bad quality machine coffee (espresso or cappuccino), croissants, breakfast rolls, toast, marmalade, chocolate spread, butter, one kind of cream cheese, one kind of ham, machine yogurt, muesli, cereal and canned pineapple/peach/plums. Breakfast was ok but still lacked freshness. Ok but overpriced; would not stay again nor recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Honesty, comfort and good location”
Reviews.Author: Claudiacj
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Nord Nuova Roma from 2 to 8 May 2011. Cleanliness and comfort of the hotel are very good, consistent with the business proposal. The breakfast is also very good, especially considering how low European standard for that meal. There was even a gluten free snack, offered to celiac customers. As for services, my husband and I do the kind of independent tourists, so we didn't schedule any tour through the hotel. So we cann't say anything about it. For this reason we chose a hotel near the train station, bus terminal and the subway, which assured us the agility to get around town. Another quality hotel: good location. However, the last day, we experienced an unpleasant situation. We asked the clerk to schedule a taxi to take us to the airport at 3:00 am. The hotel clerk told us it would cost 50 euros. Upon arriving at the airport, the driver charged us 60 euros. We paid the amount charged to avoid hassles. However, I was upset and wrote to the hotel to tell them what happened. The hotel apologized for the robbery of the driver, notified the taxi company and repaid us 10 euros by post. I was touched by the honesty of the hotel and the attention given to the customer. Therefore, I recommend the Nord Nuova Roma for any tourist who expect comfort, good location and excellent service in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in great location and very good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: faith007
Reviews.Content: Great location within a walking distance from all the main city landmarks, great bar at the top of the hotel with great views, really good breakfast, good quality and eat as much as you like, polite and helpful staff, clean rooms, nothing ti complain about. The only reason I gave it a 4, is because it lacks luxury, but I got what I paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: beyondtheinfinite
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located near the train station, almost in front of the bus terminal. The room was spacious, beds were comfortable and the bathroom clean. Though the room was facing the street, we didn't hear sound of cars passing outside, which is a plus to the sleep quality. Breakfast was average. Could have been better, given the overall high quality of Roman food. The hotel advertises it has free high-speed WI-FI in the rooms, however the connection speed is extremely poor. If you lose your patience trying to connect to the WI-FI, they offer 3 computers near the reception with decent wired connection.

Reviews.Title: “A very average and overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salcacilar
Reviews.Content: The two pluses of the hotel are its location and a sufficient breakfast which is a rare thing to find in Rome. Tried to squeeze us in a prison- cell-sized room at first but after our request changed a room onto a bigger one, though, not much bigger. Our window faced the street which is a little bit noisy but bearable. On the whole, the hotel would be ok if not for its price. For that price you would expect more than just a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPA1605
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location, walking distance from Termini station. The room given to us was clean and large (we had a king bed with additional bed for the child). The bathroom could have been bigger, especially the shower cabinet. The staff was helpful, directed us to some good restaurants around (good food and very economical). The breakfast was standard, nothing really great, but useful. The only feeling is that the rate charged for the second and third night was slightly on the higher side, (we stayed three nights, and the first night rate was much lower compared to the other two nights)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location--we'd recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: FleeFromSnow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within walking distance of the Colosseum, the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. The only place we had to take a cab to was the Vatican. The hotel itself is very nice, clean, and the concierge was very helpful to us every day. Loved the experience. Very well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and Filling Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Finckmyster
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were a bit small, bu then again its europe. the location was gr8, right across the street from the main bus and train terminal. Breakfast was amazing, a lot of food, all italian with a few american dishes. its like going to a restaurant for free.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed...clean and centrally located. I'd definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: sweetsinger
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome for the first time and since I was traveling alone, it was really helpful to stay in a hotel that is located near the center of town, two subway stops and a major bus stop. It definitely made getting around easy. Plus...I could always stop by the hotel to drop off shopping bags and head out for more exploring. Also...it's a very clean hotel. If you need a lot of amenities...this is not the place for you, though they do have a decent free breakfast. But if you just want an affordable hotel in a good location...I think this one is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: conciross
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 04 05 of Febuary 2001 , the hotel is in the perfect position only 5 minutes walk from the central station (La stazione ferroviaria di Roma Termini ) and near the metro and bus stop ! Breakfast was good and the service was fine ! We payed 96 euro a night for a room with an extra bed for our toddler a family of 4 would pay 114 euro a night if you book in advance !! when we go back to Rome we will stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: OC_M_Lu
Reviews.Content: STayed here for a week with a 30+ tour group. The location can't be beat- 10 minute walk to the Termini train station, 25 minute walk to the Collosseum and very close to the bus stops. Numerous cafes, souvenir shops and dining options (from McDonald's to a chinese, korean and indian restaurants) and gelaterias around the hotel. Walking distance to the Rome Opera House and Plaza Nazionale. Front desk staff helpful and friendly. Location is safe yet they still keep the front door locked from 11pm to I think 5am even if there's a night staff working in the lobby - i like the extra security detail. Breakfast is fantastic. Lots of choices and even if we were there for a week- we didn't get tired of the breakfast spread. the variety is great. The downside is the elevator is too tiny and seems slow at peak times. In the middle of the night too, you can hear the garbage trucks coming or going... And because it's Rome, they don't allow the use of A/C in the autumn so you have no choice but to open the windows if you want fresh air... that includes leaving it open and getting exposed to the sounds of city living; siren, garbage truck and the occasional drunk singing on his way back to his hotel... The double rooms are spacious enough, bathroom is a good size and housekeeping staff highly efficient though they speak little to no english. The rooms are outdated but we didn't go to Rome to enjoy the interior of a hotel. There is only one computer in the lobby with internet access and fee is a little too high so I have to walk closer to the Termini station where they have more affordable internet service. When we took the train from Termini to go to Venice, it only took us 10 minutes to walk from the hotel to the train station. Termini station is a destination itself and a good venue for people watching and have lots of dining options there too. Souvenir tip: If you want to buy chocolates or souvenirs to bring home to friends, look for a neighborhood convenient store where the locals go. The prices are way cheaper than duty free chocolates and souvenir shops close to major tourist stops. These convenience stores are usually hidden in street corners.... I will definitely book here if I get lucky to travel to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the price”
Reviews.Author: rontheworld
Reviews.Content: Excelent location, i stay 2 days. Great breakfast, the room i take was very confortable, but 1 room of my family was small. The staff are very kind, i recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility”
Reviews.Author: shoover
Reviews.Content: If you plan to use Rome as your base to make day/overnight trips by train this is the perfect hotel . Maybe 2 blocks from the Termini , but very quiet, and an easy walk with bags. The rooms are very nice as are the amenities and breakfast. The only improvement we could recommend is that 2/3 of the staff learn to be as pleasant as the other 1/3.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, but room is not very good”
Reviews.Author: Volcanoking
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, near to Roma Termini station. Room is too small for the money we pay. All tapes in the toilet are old ones and it was so difficult to open and close. The flush did not work properly. Soap was too bad quality. Room was so noisy even you can hear somebody walking outside. So, could not sleep well. Staff was not friendly. I enquired about sight seeing with the receptionist and he gave me the details of some sight seeing company. I asked him another company name and if I could find them near the station. He was no more interested in telling me and said, you may find. But that company was just opposite the hotel. I thought as he could not get any commission as I took another company, he was not interested in giving me details.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast, Average rooms”
Reviews.Author: jmdavis711
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a short walk to many of the tourist sights in Rome (excluding only the Vatican). Only a few of the staff knew English, but those who did knew it well and made communication easy. There was a wide variety of choices for breakfast. The only downside to the hotel is the antiquity of the rooms: ours seemed like it hadn't been decorated in 30 years. With many of the hotels in Europe being remodeled, the outdated furniture stood out to my wife and me. Despite that, I would still recommend the hotel for its courteous staff, great location, and wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel stay, VERY clean place”
Reviews.Author: Fabgurrl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our AAA travel agent and was very impressed with the cleanliness of the place. I was traveling with my husband and mother in law, so we had 2 beds in one part of the room and the other side was a desk, sofa bed , TV and wardrobe closet with safe. and the bathroom with tub and shower was in between us. We had a small balcony which faced the back of another hotel. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and spoke english. I would definitely stay here again. the breakfast in the morning was good. not much daily variety but it managed to save us a few euro each day to splurge on other meals. so that's a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: elyoar
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night at this hotel. The room was quite small but very nice and clean. The bathroom was clean, spacious and beautiful. The water pressure and temperature for the shower was good. Our room overlooked the alley way which we didn't mind as it was quiet during the night. The bed was soft and comfortable. There is a small fee for the wifi but it worked very well in our room. The location is great! Only a few minutes from the termini station. We wanted to stay at this hotel again when we passed through, but they were booked. We definitely would stay here again if we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tanzanitediamond
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Nord Nuova Roma hotel by our travel company and it was a great choice. The hotel was old so it had old world charm and was immaculately maintained. The hotel was located near the train & bus station, a metro station was easily accessible and the hotel was walking distance to many local attractions. The room was spacious, especially compared to European standards, which an equaly large bathroom. The staff courteous and extremely helpful especially to a tourist unfamiliar with the cityl. There was a roof top terrace which was a serene oasis in the midst of the bustling city, which offered drinks and light snacks and a view of the city including St. Peter's Basilica in the distance. The breakfast buffet was substantial. They had several computers available for checking email or web searching at a nominal cost of 1 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations of location, value and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: bri99su
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a 24-hour layover in Rome, having received a recommendation from a friend. Overall, it was a lovely hotel, and I wish I could have spent more than one night there! It was a quick (5 minute) walk from the train station and very convenient for a walking tour of the city. I found my room to be very comfortable, modern, and clean. I also enjoyed the breakfast buffet the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for me”
Reviews.Author: wareagle125
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in single room during Spring Break 2010. Room was very clean and plenty spacious for a solo traveler. Close to the Termini Station so easy access to Metro and buses. Breakfast area was always crowded.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy a rude staff, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: rodendo1
Reviews.Content: While the accomadations and location were fine, the desk staff could be very rude. We lost luggage that was to arrive there during our stay and they were less than willing to check on it's arrival whenever we inquired.

Reviews.Title: “best location, wait until they turn the air conditioners on!”
Reviews.Author: debbieel
Reviews.Content: the best location in Rome. right next to the train station, metro lines and buses. Lots of traffic made it a bit noisy. Normally we wouldn't notice,but since they hadn't turned on the air conditioning yet( it was up to the manager when to turn on the air) we had to leave the window open to get some breeze. Leaving the window open let in the noise also. During the day,there was no cool breeze, so taking an afternoon rest was quite uncomfortable. this was the middle of May. If you go before then, I'm sure it will be nice and cool. The breakfast was good, but it is the same every day and after 5 days, we were bored with it.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of great for the price considering what yo get in the rest of Rome”
Reviews.Author: tysonroxy
Reviews.Content: Rome is really overpriced for what you get in general and basicaly any place can label themselves 3 star without really living up to any sort of standard. The Hotel Nord Nuova was a welcome suprise with a pretty good breakfast, a nice clean large room and bathroom, a gym, and a roofttop bar. Its also near the central train station, so its easy to get back to the airport, or around Rome, or to just take off to other cities. The area is central. I've read things saying that its bad area, unsafe or whatever, but I did not find that.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel breakfast was terrible, almost uneatable”
Reviews.Author: UllaKlara
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week and were very pleased with the hotel room. But when trying to eat the breakfast the next day we were very disappointed! Tried to communicate with the personnel but they claimed that the eggs should be hardboiled and green etc, etc, We tried for 2 days to talk to both the reception as well as the breakfast service staff but they were very rude and said that we wore wrong and had to accept what they offered. Then we gave up! So if you want to have a good start in the day and want to have breakfast - pls don´t book this hotel! There are so many other good hotels to choose instead.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for central location”
Reviews.Author: kaffeee
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for business recently. Fairly standard European style hotel. good breakfast buffet, front desk staff very helpful. Supposed to have a free meal with my 2 night booking. Went to restaurant in sister hotel as requested, chose menu that waiter pointed out to me when I explained I was from the Nord, only to discover at end that it wasn't the free one so please check if you're expecting this - My italian wasn't good enough to check!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as Pictured”
Reviews.Author: sushi3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and found it to be exactly what we expected. The hotel staff were all very nice. I arrived six hours after my cousin and her cell phone wasn't working. The front desk called me for her. The doorman was very friendly and suggested restaurants in the area. The room was large enough with a little balcony in the back of the building. No noise from outside. The bathroom was not large, but very nice and clean. Nice fluffy towels. They have room service for breakfast as an alternative to going to the breakfast room. The breakfast room was very nice and the offerings were typical. The location was perfect for walking with luggage from Termini and is close to all transportation. The Termini area is very safe. Don’t believe everything you hear. The rooftop terrace was very pretty with beautiful views with a bar and cafe. Nice to have a cocktail before heading out to dinner. The lobby area is made up of different rooms and all are exactly as pictured on their website. They have internet, but not sure if they charge for it. My only complaint was that they didn’t have any dresser drawers in the bedroom – only an amoire to hang your clothes with open shelves at the bottom. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marathin1959
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay at this hotel. The triple room and attached bathroom were clean and spacious. Although our room was on the first floor facing the road which had a fair bit of traffic, there was no disturbance as the soundproofing was effective. The Front Office staff were helpful and informative about local sightseeing and travel. The location was excellent, it being a seven minute walk from Roma termini and the local bus station. Lot of eating places nearby as well. However we did not try the hotel's terrace restaurant. The cold buffet breakfast was a good spread.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PGRBrussels
Reviews.Content: In a city where hotels are notoriously expensive and standards are low, the Bettoja Hotel Nord is a great choice in Rome. excellent location just far enough away from Termini but close enough for good transport links (both Metro and bus). Spotlessly clean, nice lobby and with old style charm. Bedrooms quite small but well equipped with nice bathroom. Maid service good, reception staff OK. Breakfast served in lovely dining room - although only having large tables means you either have to share or wait for a table. Breakfast itself is disappointing.for such a nice hotel...(typically) dry bread, tinned fruit (?) croissants, cereal, some ham and cheese. the juice is also pretty poor - coffee good. Overall though a positive experience and would definitely recommend the Bettoja Nord..and if you can wait until the last minute to book there are great offers directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - GREAT PRICE Best Deal I got in Rome”
Reviews.Author: teenniee
Reviews.Content: I scoured the internet looking for a hotel... and Im miss cheapo. Some of the other places I looked at online.. looked ok, but when I saw them in person in rome. I said hellzzz no. So Im glad I just gave in I got this one. Even though it was still a little pricey... but hey this is Rome. I really got lucky this time. Up until 2 days before my trip. I still was looking for a hotel. Even considered priceline. But I got a great summer promotion deal, directly from the hotel website. They have a lot of deals going on if you scroll down and look to the right. A single room with 2 beds at 77 euro a night, plus it was a 3 star . ($110) The staff was very friendly, the continental breakfast was adequate. Cold cerals, toast, boiled eggs, pastries, cakes, coffee/ hot chocolate machine, juice machine, yogurt, etc Matter of fact I even made a few ham cheese and crossiant sandwiches to take with me during the day. The room and bathroom was clean. Beautiful terrace upstairs. Also its So close to the termini station that we walked maybe 4 minutes. And its easy to find. Close to everything.. I only booked for 3 nights.... but after checking the hotels neighbouring this one and the outrageous prices, I asked If i could book the other three nights at the same price at the front desk. and they agreed. The A/C after a hot days walk wasnt the coldest, but was cool enough. NO IRON in the hotel at all, So iron your clothes before. Also no adapters at the front desk for usa appliances. The bathroom hair dryer appliance has a 120 plug. but double check before plugging in. Also no free wifi. . The computer station they offer downstairs is .35 cents a minute. But you can go to an internet cafe around the corner which is way cheaper. Also the only tv station in english is CNN world. Lotssss of resturants nearby - all pricey. But like i said this is Rome. There is a mini fridge under the desk.. so you can have at least a cold beer or soda after a long day. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: auldaquaintance
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute before we travelled to Italy and found it to be very clean, tidy, staff helpful especially the barman who worked in the roof terrace bar - which was fab place to relax with a drink after a long day's walking etc. Room we were allocated was one of the rooms which had not been refurbished however was adequate,clean, tidy - linen/towels changed daily. Although on the small side was perfect as did not spend a long time in the room. Breakfast plentiful. The area is considered somewhat unsafe but at no point did we feel threatened when out walking - even late at night! Can I suggest that to those of the guests who found staff unhelpful - learn a little Italian before you intend to visit as there is nothing worse that expecting someone to speak your language when you travel and then complain when you cannot be understood. All in all a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good breakfast, some bad service experience”
Reviews.Author: Minibus2005
Reviews.Content: This is the first time My wife and I visit rome for 2 days then we stayed in florence for another 6 days We arrived earlier at 10am and given a room in 5/F, but later found the room is not avaliable yet and the manager assign a much smaller and darker room in the 1/F floor near the toliet. Since we took 13 hours flight and my wife wants took a shower and also told the manager to switch back the 5/F room to us while we are waiting in the room. Later the manager called back we can't use the room however my wife already took a shower (we didn't touch anything except used one towel). When we back to the lobby the manager was so rude to us and blame we used the shower and intended not to switch to room for us. although, our room was changed, I am very disappointed on the the manager bad attitude. When I was another hotel in Singapore last time with similar issue, I was very welcome to use the temporay room. I think for whatever reason, bad attitude is not acceptable for a service industry. Location : excellent Breakfast: very good Room: good Price: ok

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrianinMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for threee nights in early May. The price was average for a Rome hotel in May. The rooms were slightly larger than an average three star hotel room. The nice thing about this hotel is the continental breakfast which was excellent, as well as the lobby area which had more than enoug room for gathering with friends while trying to plan the days activities. Also a star on this hotel was the rooftop bar, which was great for cooling off with a Peroni after a long day of touring Roman sites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyNYC
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel. It is in a great location near many important cultural sites. It is also near a transportation hub which makes getting around the city easy. The hotel lobby is lovely. The concierges were always helpful and I was travelling alone so I had lots of questions. My room was small but clean and had everything I needed. There is a great restaurant on the corner. There is a nice exercise room and a rooftop terrace with refreshments. There is also a good free breakfast. I have absolutely nothing bad to say at all except that the Internet service in the lobby was very expensive. Besides that if I ever went to Rome again, I would go to that hotel in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “More than a 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: headortail
Reviews.Content: The location is impressive very close to termini station (national international trains, metro, bus). The walking distance to the station is 2-5 minutes. It gives you quick access to all the spots to visit in Rome. The room was clean and well furnished. There were both italian and english channels on the TV. The hotel is quiet and well decorated. The staff is helpful but could be a bit more friendly. They are fluent in English. They printed maps for us, gave us good advices... The breakfast is good and served until 10.30. Overall, this hotel is very good for Rome and better than 4 stars I have been to during the same vacation. It is definitely a great hotel to go to while visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Simple but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slopes
Reviews.Content: Choose an hotel in Rome it's not an easy task! I went there with 2 friends, and we spent a couple of days reading reviews, comparing prices.. Then we discovered this hotel, and what we found was exactly what we expected, and even a litlle more, a nice breakfast, something that I thing it's not so easy to find in a normal hotel in Rome :) It's true that the reception could be more kind and attentious, but we were so tired when we arrived at the hotel that we almost didn't noticed :) The location was perfect for us, close to Termini, and a good start for a nice walking in Rome. Overall it was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “No problem one-nighter”
Reviews.Author: mpeopl678
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Rome because our flight left so early the next morning after a week in the Tuscany region. We had two rooms, both of which were twins. They were both clean and comfortable with small balconys with doors that opened. We felt safe and secure and the front desk staff was helpful and friendly and arranged airport transportation (van w/ driver) for us the next morning. The continental breakfast buffet was included and was well-stocked and fresh. The service was good. We had absolutely no complaints. One of the rooms had a larger tub/shower combo which was more desirable than the other which just had a shower. We had reserved queens but in order to check in earlier than regular check-in time we agreed to take the twins. The linens on the beds were superb - very crisp and clean. The bathroom was well stocked. The room was a little warm and the hotel A/C was not available this time of year but with the doors open it was fine. I'd return to this hotel. It was close to the coliseum and other interesting sites.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Pissoff4ever
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff are extremely unhelpful and unfriendly, bordering on being rude to guests. The location is near the termini, but the surrounding area is unsafe. We were being mugged by walking from the termini to the hotel in the evening. The room is also small and dark. Amenities are adequate, but are not worth the price we have to pay. For the same price, you can get better services than the hotel staff are willing to provide.

Reviews.Title: “Rome was Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Wendi15
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and were taking the cruise liner from Civitevecchia, we stayed at Bettoja Hotel Nord Nuova Roma for a few days in order to tour Rome. The hotel is close to the Termini Station and also the bus station so that was a big plus! The first room which we were given had an a/c unit which did not work so we were moved to another room which was a lot better than the first, it actually seemed to be an upgrade. The staff were friendly, rooms clean and our upgraded room was fine. The breakfast was continental with cold meats etc, as is the case with most european hotels, but it was fine for what it was. My husband and I liked the property and would not hesitate to recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Simple stay at Bettoja Hotel Nord Nuova Roma”
Reviews.Author: name_screen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bettoja Hotel Nord Nuova Roma in September 2008 for 2 nights prior to a Mediterranean cruise. It is near the Termini station; the neighborhood is better as you move away from the Termini station. It's a simple 3-star hotel with basic room accommodations, clean, and simple. Breakfast is included and served on the main floor including breads, cereal, cheese, meats, jams, coffee, tea, etc. The nicest spot is the roof deck for a quiet drink and an incredible view. The lobby has Internet access computer available. Tourist places such as Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain are within walking distance, although bring your quality walking shoes in Rome. I would recommend this hotel to visitors for a short stay in Rome, looking for simple and clean accommodations. For a 4-star stay, the Bettoja has a sister hotel less than 3 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great for visiting rome”
Reviews.Author: CatloveYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to use for visiting Rome, easy to get to from airport being just a few minutes from direct train into Rome from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Angel_Star
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located and very easy to walk to the metro (Republica) or the buses (termini). The rooms were very small but we managed. Everything was spotlessly clean. The breakfasts were ok but the cappucino was fantastic. They only have one English satellite channel and that is CNN and the TV reception was awful. The room was very hot and the aircon didn't feel cold and it was noisy. We asked for a room at the back of the hotel (on 4th floor) and we did hear early morning deliveries (about 4am) but we did have the window open.... We only booked this hotel because we got the 4th night free, so it worked out ok for value but if you don't get a deal, i would say it is expensive and only great because of location. The Roof Terrace is a must in the evening, view of the Baths is fantastic and nothing beats an ice cold beer with great music and free nuts! Rome doesn't have many "supermarkets" and we only found DeSpar in the Termini and on Nationzale Road which isn't far which helps to buy things like water etc. The Est Est Est pizzeria around the corner is a great place to eat and very reasonably priced. Rome is very hilly and although you can walk to most things, it is too draining in the heat (about 35 deg in July). Bus 40 and 64 are the best and the metro is so easy and aircond (also very frequent , never waited more than 3 mins). We got the RomaPass which is worthwhile as it incls all transport for 3 days and two museum passes (not the Vatican). We used it for the Coloseum and the Palantine (linked) - also a great tip using the Romapass for the Coloseum/Palatine is skipping the queues. We also used it for the Terme Diocletizian (Baths) - not worth a visit unless you like lots of Roman busts but it diid also incl the National Roman Museum which was great for mosiacs. The Romapass also incl Galeria Borghese but you have to book beforehand so if you are into art - do this before visiting. The Vatican is a must but the queues were awful - queued in the blazing sun for more than 1.5hrs in the heat, not recommended for children.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaint”
Reviews.Author: jpmich
Reviews.Content: I had a single room w/ a twin bed. For one person it was plenty of room. The place was perfect for what i needed: Great location, right across the street from the train and metro station, walking distance to everything I wanted to see. The area seemed very safe. It has an okay fitness room should you feel the need. Roof top bar was nice. Wireless internet, although not cheap, ~$20/day and I just did the low-end plan and it was fine for making video calls through Skype.

Reviews.Title: “Only if no other option!”
Reviews.Author: tourist_hants_uk
Reviews.Content: The only positive point about this hotel is its location i.e. near to Termini rail station. If this is the only criterion there are plenty of similarly priced better hotels near by (some 4 stars). We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in July. Here are the points I disliked... 1. The front desk reception staff were not helpful. To start with they asked me to keep the passport at the reception and come back in half hour to collect it. As it would take them 30 minutes to complete the check-in formalities. Wonder why ? I remained at the desk and they eventually did complete the check-in in the next 10 minutes. 2. We were 3 of us including our 14 months baby. We were given a room with 2 single beds. We were provided with a child cot later. I do not expect a classic double bed room to have two single beds. The room decoration was in-adequate. 3. We were recommended an open top bus tour Ciao Roma. We were asked to pay 6 Euros to the hotel front desk and remaining 13 euros to the bus company. This tour company unlike the several others stopped far away from places of interest. Hence we had a long walk to where we wanted to go. Plus even after charging the 6 euros we had paid for the reservation we did not get a seat on the top floor of the bus. 4. The morning breakfast was just about average. No fresh juice. There was a juice machine (from a concentrate). 5. No kettle in rooms. (But I guess generally true with all hotels in Italy). 6. There was a standing shower with curtains. Water spilled out after a shower. Positive points ... 1. Near Termini train station. 2. The staff did call a Taxi whenever required. 3. They have a locker room to keep luggage after you checkout. So you do not need to take your luggage to any other left luggage facility. 4. Near a few attractions. If I visit Rome again I will not stay in this Hotel. There are plenty nearby and if you do not want to stay near Termini then there are other very good hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AvinashJha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and good. The breakfast was sumptuous. The rooms were well decorated with nice interiors... Overall a pleasant stay and value for money...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, good breakfast ....”
Reviews.Author: PDXHelmut
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Bettoja Nord Hotel for two nights and found the hotel to be very conveniently located, just 3 blocks from Termini train station. (easy walk without too much luggage). The room was very nice and clean and non-smoking (really!); there was low water pressure in the bathroom shower, but it was manageable. The breakfast room is elegant and the buffet breakfast delightful, including rolls, hard boiled eggs, cold cuts, cereals, fruits, coffee, tea, juices. The hotel also has a lovely rooftop terrace bar, where we had a drink in the evening. (kinda spendy though!) We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magmosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days while in Rome on a package through Austrian Airlines. We upgraded to this hotel and I'm really glad we did! The hotel is easy walking distance from the train station. When we first got there, the reception was quite rushed. Our room wasn't ready, we decided to head up to the roof top bar. We sat up there for about an hour as they readied our room - roof top bar a nice treat. It was a great retreat from the frenetic activity on the streets below. We had some refreshments and just sat still for a while after navigating train stations and trains the whole day. We got a room on the 3rd floor. While there was some noise from outside, it was nothing that kept us from going to sleep. The room was very comfortable. Nice flat screen TV. Really liked the bathroom. It was immaculate and well laid out. They gave us plenty of soap and towels. The marble floor in the bathroom was beautiful - and shiny clean. The hotel is an easy walk to the Colosseum, Forum and Palatine Hill. It's really not a bad walk to other sights, either. We did, however, take a cab to the Vatican (to save our feet and backs for the day there). After the initial rushed experience with the front desk, they proved to be very helpful and accommodating. They assisted with a (VERY) early shuttle to the airport. Breakfast was good. The breakfast room was only crowded once while we were there. The coffee was good, food quality was good, choices varied. Overall, a very nice stay. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome! We would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterwanabes
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very quick trip to Rome for a day and a half. This hotel was great! As the other reviews stated your only 2 blocks from the main Termini train station to where you can get to the Metro or Airport. Hotel itself was nice and the room was generous. Room was clean and so was the bathroom. The view was nothing however but we were only there to relax and sleep. The only bad thing I have to say about the place was there food and room service. They have this great menu but when I called at about 9:00 pm they said they didn't have any food? Hmm......oh well there are great restuarants about a block from where we stayed. Try EST...EST....EST.....Pizzeria good place to eat! The breakfast was also great. Any breakfast that has hard boiled eggs and cheese with cereal is great in my book. So that was an added bonus. The +'s of the room: -Clean and inviting. -Clean bathroom -friendly staff -Comfortable bed -Close to the termini Train station -Close to good restaurants that are a block away. -Breakfast The -'s: -Room service/food? -Noise outside but it's Rome. Tips on Rome: -at the airport they have the "Leonardo Express" that comes every 30 minutes to Rome termini. -Be prepared to walk, bring comfortable shoes and throw away fashion. -If interested in guided walks use Context travel. Great company.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in OK location”
Reviews.Author: EandSNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are very polite (not friendly - but very professional and curteous). We used the hotel to book our taxi from/to the airport and everything ran smoothly (even though it took nearly an hour to get through passport control, our taxi driver was waiting patiently for us ). We had two double rooms (464 and 480). Both were fine (roomier than expected - 464 had a bath and 480 a large shower). Even though we were there over Easter, and the hotel is near a main road, we were not kept awake - a good night's sleep was had by all. Breakfast buffet was just OK - reasonable choice of items but the quality is lacking - Missed fresh fruit/juice. If you want to be near the termini, the location is great. However, it is not the prettiest area - definitely practical but not romantic. There are much nicer areas in Rome and the difference in price is minimal. Would suggest vatican/flori areas. Among other services, the hotel offers to book a "hop-on hop-off" Bus Tour on your behalf. My advice is to give this one a miss. There is no guide on the bus, only a tape with apparently no pause button. The bus got stuck in traffic and the tape kept playing so we were given information about landmarks over half a mile away. At 19 Euro each, not value for money - we could have sat on one of the city busses all day for 1 Euro ! Do your research on tour companies before you go as the enjoyment of any of the sights depends so much on the quality of the guide/size of the group. Some are much better than others.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: NYCece
Reviews.Content: After searching forever so that we could find a great hotel with a great location, we settled on this hotel. After we booked it, we found a few negative reviews about the "unfriendly" staff, which is the complete opposite. When we arrived, the staff was kind enough to give my friend and I an upgrade on our room just so that we could stay on the same floor as the other people were traveling with (upgrade was free by the way). The room was spacious as was the bathroom, plus the lighting was great to put makeup on in. The continental breakfast every morning was more than we could ask for. The hours for breakfast were great, starting at 6 until 10. It was great when we had late nights, we could just stay up for another hour or two and catch breakfast then sleep. My favorite part of the hotel was the rooftop terrace. The bartender up there, Fortunato, was such great help and was definitely one of the highlights of my trip. He was not only able to singlehandedly entertain my friend and I but he also gave us great places to hang out and be able to fully experience Roma. The staff at the front desk were also extremely helpful. There were more than willing to help out with us, no matter how silly our requests were and they also tolerated us, which is a lot to ask someone for. Not every hotel has staff that will get on their hands and knees and help you look for a lost thumb drive under the couches in the lobby. We stayed in this hotel for two weeks, as we were in Roma for business as well as fun. The location was great. It was in walking distance of so many great sites and was also walking distance from Termini station. In terms of hotels, this one has it all and I will be staying there every time I find myself in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near Termini”
Reviews.Author: stpaulites
Reviews.Content: The last stop on our whirlwind Italian honeymoon was Rome and thank goodness -- a great hotel in a great location! After spending a total of 6 nights in supposed 3-star hotels in Florence and Venice, this hotel had everything we thought we were paying for at the other hotels: a rather spacious, clean room; a nice bathroom; relative sound-proofing; very good service (incl. a varied breakfast); and best of all... the best location in Rome. To be close to the metro and train station was great after walking (and walking) great distances in the other cities we visited to return to hotels that were reportedly "near" the hot spots. I would recommend this hotel to anyone... my mom, my best friend, my boss! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “super location and price”
Reviews.Author: dawn5851
Reviews.Content: We arrived back in rome for the last leg of our Italy trip. We came from Naples via train into termini. We walked 2 blks to this hotel easily with luggage. Front desk prompt and friendly. Elevators good and big. Our standard room was clean and neat. Decent closet space, could have used another luggage rack but we moved the bench and made it happen. Safe gave us a bit of trouble twice, but was fixed within 30 minutes. Hotel lobby, breakfast room and bar --gorgeous and clean. Breakfast was a bit weak compared to our other 2 hotels, yet yummy and fresh. Staff very attentive! Bartender treated me like Gold every night when i had my night cap. Loved the decor and walk the stairway at least once to look at the sketches. Main bonus the location. Didn't find the area scary or dangerous at all. Wouldn't walk through the little dark park by the termini though. Easily advoidable. We stayed by the forum for the 1st leg of the trip and walked everywhere. Now we got the roma pass and used the metro and buses to get to villa B and the Vatican and down to the Paramid etc. Its great because no matter how bad u mess up. Your bus will eventually come to a Metro stop and that will always take to to termini! EASY system to use, even for those who never tried mass transit. Our room overlooked the Diocletian Baths and it was a lovely site day and night. Wanted to eat in the sister hotel down the street, but the wine celler restaurant was closed and the other was way to pricey. Lots and lots of little local places in the 4 blocks west and south. Also the Opera house is 2 blks NW and there must be tons of great spots. Never got there or to see an opera--but lots of literature in the lobby for those interested. I heard its worth it if you can fit it in. Overall the hotel can be a bit loud, but we were to tired to care (again wine helps with all these little annoyances). I think its a good pick for a great price for those interested in using mass transit. Oh and they gave us a prompt wake-up call at 3:30am and we walked over to termini and got a cab to the airport easily. Cabs always there. Unlike Newark --NOBODY is working at the airport before 5:30 am so don't rush too much.

Reviews.Title: “Brill Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandbtl
Reviews.Content: I spent ages searching the internet for a budget hotel and using recommendations for this site stayed at this hotel. Even so I still expected a budget hotel for the price. However we were very pleasantly surprised. What a lovely hotel. Great position, lovely little cafe/coffee bar just round the corner which was nice when we retruned late in the evening for a pre bedtime hot chocolate. Staff were very nice, lovely continental buffet breakfast, beautiful clean room. Cannot fault in any way and cant believe its only a 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny we spent”
Reviews.Author: Gusamas
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Near the Rome termini station about a 3 minutes walk. From the FCO airport you can take the train to the termini and just walk from there. We walked to the colosseum, Trevi, Pantheon, Victor Emannuel and the Spanish step. One word of advice to those traveling from the airport. Do not take the shuttle TERRAVISION. If they see that there are not enough people they will not bother to stop to pick you. Take the train instead.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: luvtw0travel
Reviews.Content: Pro: Close to train station which makes it easy to find when first arriving to Rome. Con: A little to far away from the sights you want to see and the train station has some shady people hanging around it. Pro: Clean and a really great rooftop bar. Con: Staff is unfriendly and not helpful at all. They gave us bad directions. The walls are way to thin. We could hear EVERYTHING and I mean everything going on in the room next to us.

Reviews.Title: “Killer location”
Reviews.Author: mustangcharlie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of EVERYTHING! Pretty much everything you want to see is either within walking distance or accessible from the Termini just across the street. As a bonus, the Termini is referenced on every bus and subway map in the city so you always have a landmark to navigate back to. The hotel itself is full of small rooms and the elevator plays arguably the worst rendition of the classic Elvis hit "Are You Lonesome Tonight?" ever commited to audio tape. It sounds like a chinese karaoke singer on amateur night at the VFW. Aside from that, the breakfast buffet is delicious and contrary to some of the other folks I found the staff to be helpful. The hotel is near a ton of restaurants, particularly if you venture down Via Giovanni Amendola towards Via Cavour. If you walk downhill on Via Cavour, it takes you toward the Coliseum which will be on your left. Total walking time from the hotel to the Coliseum is about 20 minutes. Be aware that the walk back to the hotel is basically all uphill though, and you'll already be tired from walking around sightseeing. At any rate, I would definately stay here again when I return to Rome. The location is just too good to pass up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & great value”
Reviews.Author: DCEFrance
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes walk from Tremini (train) station in the north of the centre of Rome. Most buses begin and end at Termini station so one can get just about anywhere. Also the north/south subway stops at Termini so one is only a couple of stops away from the Colloseum or the Vatican. We were pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel and the services for the price. The rooms were relatively spacious as were the bathrooms (absolutely no problems with our showers in both of our rooms). The staff were polite and helpful. The rooftop bar is a great place to end the night especially when it's really hot (as it always is in August in Rome). Overall a well-placed hotel with above-average quality and services.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but terrible showers!”
Reviews.Author: mochynmon
Reviews.Content: Good location for public transport - Termini is main hub for Metro and bus routes. It was very handy arriving from Fiumicino airport - just hopped on the Leonardo Express to Termini, and then crossed the road from the station and we were at the hotel! Colosseum and Roman Forum is about 20 min walk down Via Cavour. A little far to walk to the other main sights - about 45 mins at least - but it's easy to catch direct buses or metro to most places. Hotel was ok - good value for what we paid (about 100 Euros a night), and what you would expect from a 3* hotel. Gymnasium was much better than we expected - new CV machines, and good weights for women. Not the best weights for men though - my husband laughed when he saw that 10 kilos was the heaviest! Roof top terrace bar was also a nice place to have a drink before heading out for the evening - nice view and relaxing atmosphere. Only real complaint would be the showers - more like a drip of water to be honest! It always took a good while to get all the shampoo out of my hair! Also, the staff weren't that friendly/helpful to be honest, even though I spoke Italian to them. On the other hand, it seems that most staff in hotels/shops in Rome aren't the biggest smilers in the world! Good areas for restaurants/bars - Trastevere (need to catch linea 'H' bus from outside Termini station, takes about 20 mins); Campo di Fiori is a bit touristy but plenty of restaurants with outside seating and good atmos. One nice place to eat by the hotel is 'La Gallina Bianca' - can't remember the name of the street it's on, but it's just off Via Cavour, about 5 mins from hotel. Bar Artu in Trastevere (just off Piazza d'Egizzio) is a good place to start a night out - they serve delicious and FREE aperitivo between 1930-2130. All in all, Rome is highly recommended if you're looking for a city break with plenty of sights, good food and nightlife. Hotel is good value for money on the whole, if a little too far away from the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shirley_friends
Reviews.Content: This is a good 3 star hotel! It's just around the corner from Termini station, so no need for taxis to & from the station. It's clean, good facilities & the staff are very friendly. Would go back again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality - no problems !”
Reviews.Author: GayTraveller50
Reviews.Content: Good quality 3* hotel near Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Zanadu44
