Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from Italy. Spent 4 days in Rome and it was hot...90's every day. The hotel room was small but perfect for just 2 of us. Great location...nearby the train station and buses. We were worried about the pickpockets as we had heard stories about that, but we just kept close and did not see any. The front desk staff were fine, not overly friendly, but did answer our questions. The roof top terrace bar was GREAT...we liked that the best. The male bartender..Fortunado (spelling?) was fantastic. He really knew how to make you feel comfortable and always there ensuring you had everything you needed. He was there during our first 3 nights. The last night, there was a female bartender (since Fortunado had the night off)who did not speak any English and was not friendly at all. It took her about 20 minutes both time before she came over to take our order. It wasn't that she was busy as there was only one other group there as well. She basically just stood there and did nothing...never brought us snacks...nothing. We did complain to the front desk. SHE was the only disappointing thing about the hotel. The breakfast was good as well and our room's a/c worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - Nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: Badgrbob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location being close to the Termini and walking distance to Trevi and Colloseum. Best advice I can give is to get an all day pass at a newpaper or Tobacci stand for the Metro Subway. The A & B lines will take you anywhere in Rome quickly. The hotel was clean and the room was typically small for Europe. I was there in mid May and the weather was in the 80's F but the room was not hot. The air seemed to stop working after day 3 of 4. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance down Nationale. Giglio restaurant was very good. Breakfast consisted of canned fruit cocktail, breads, sweet rolls, juice, hard boiled eggs, parma ham & cheese. Not bad to kick start the day. The roof top lounge was very cool. Great view of the city all the way to St Peters. The only glitch I had was when I checked out they wanted to charge me for the room that I had already paid for in advance with frequent traveler points through AMEX. I just left them my confirmation and credit card info and figured they could work it out with AMEX. They must have because I haven't been charged since. I would stay here again because of the location. I would advise not using the internet service at the hotel. Very expensive. There is an internet shop right next door that is very cheap. One word of advice after reading review after review about staff and Italians in general not being friendly or helpful. It's there country and if that is the way they want to act, so be it. I am there for the sites, food and wine. Not the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ksigui
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is wonderful for tourist using the metro and getting to and from the Termini station. The room was clean and spacious. The service was decent. We ran into problems with the laundry service but the hotel took care of it. Good hotel for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: BillandAmy
Reviews.Content: We are experienced travelers and found the Hotel Nord Nuova Roma to be less than what either a tourist or business traveller should expect. The staff was not very helpful at all. We were informed that the air conditioning in the hotel was not working. So, for 5 nights, no air conditioning. When checking out we had ordered a taxi to pick us up the next morning to take us to the airport. Instead of a taxi, a non metered mercedes picked us up. 50 Euros!!!! Not much of a choice since we had to get to the airport. I wonder who made some money off that deal?

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNYtravels
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for three nights, and it was great. Not the most lux accomodations, but comfortable and clean - and above all is location. We were just steps aways from the main train station which made travel between cities much easier. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room had a great view and we weren't bothered by noise at all. The roof deck is lovely and a great place for a drink before setting out for dinner. There was a computer in the lobby where we were able to get online for a nominal fee. There's a decent gym too. The breakfast was better than expected from reading previous reviews - it was filling and there was a decent amount of variety. I'd strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: charonne
Reviews.Content: Good situation, near Metro, and at 15 mn walk to Colesum and Trevisia Fontain. Hotel is clean and spacious. But Air Conditionning was OFF. Even we were there in May, and it was hot. So, we had to open the windows. We heard the other rooms. Fitness room is very beautifull, even if the equipment is limited. I appreciate that breakfast is included, for all guests, even if booked on internet.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Stinks”
Reviews.Author: Bern38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nord Nuova in Rome for three days in April, 2007. While the hotel itself was pretty nice, very clean, I would never stay here again. First of all the people at the front desk are very very rude and unprofessional, expecially the two bald headed men. One is shorter than the other. These two men should be wardens in a jail, and not have jobs dealing with people. They DO NOT go out of their way to please at all. If you ask them a question, they become very agitated and act like you are totally bothering them. With attitudes like these two have, they definitely rub off on the rest of the front desk personnel. Terrible. As we continued our trip to Sorrento, the people there were MUCH MUCH MORE pleasant and accommodating, as the people were in Florence and Venice. I would NEVER NEVER recommend this hotel because of these people. The only person who was soooo nice was the bartender on the rooftop bar, Fortunato. He was friendly, pleasant and went out of his way to help us with any questions we had about the area and sights we wanted to see. As for the location of this hotel, it is not very convenient either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great breakfast and comfortable clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: chehalis
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel via airport shuttle, which was a good choice. Door to door service no searching for the hotel dragging our luggage behind. Check in was smooth and we were taken to our room by the bell hop. We were in room 667. The only disappointment with the room was the view...there was none! Our windows opened to the center of the building so all we saw were other rooms. It was a large room, we had a triple so the couch was made up as a bed. It was very comfortable. It had two twin beds (these were firm), a desk, mini bar (not to expensive), a tv that didn't work or we couldn't get it to work...but who is watching tv while in Rome. The closet was a large walk in with a safe and hooks for our coats.The bathroom was large marble room a few issues with the shower...no water pressure at all and there was a smell coming from the drains which wasn't too bad with the windows open. There was a roof top bar that was really nice and the view as incrediable at night. Breakfast was really good. They had canned fruit, rolls and breads, frozen yogurt, meat and cheese, hard boiled eggs,cereal and Juice and my personal favorite was the coffee served at the table with a pitcher of steamed milk. We had a problem at check out but I think it was due to some miscommunication with the travel agent regarding the price. I was able to negotiate with the manager and got it closer to what I expected. The location of this hotel was really good. And I felt safe with two teen girls walking at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: t6298df
Reviews.Content: The Nord is a business class hotel in a convenient location for a short stay. I booked a weekend stay at advanced stay discount. It was quite good and we enjoyed the breakfasts. Since we arrived and left from the train station, transfers were easy. But it is far from the better restaurants. I tried to book a hotel near the Spanish Steps, but Sunday night was sold out for some reason at every reasonably priced hotel. As a backup, I made a reservation at the Nord. We had stayed there in 2000, but since had used other hotels in Rome. It was quite a bit cheaper than any other available hotels. If we hadn't stayed there before, I might have wondered if the low price indicated there was a problem. The bathrooms are large compared to the rooms. They have been renovated with marble, have a nice tub/shower and a stool to use at the counter to put on makeup. The rooms are small but adequate. Our TV was small and awkwardly placed. It was an upper floor and the room was so hot, that we had to keep the window open to keep it cool enough. Since it opened onto an internal ventilation shaft, noise was not an issue. When we took a taxi back to the hotel, we found it easiest to ask for Piazza della Repubblica. It's very close and there are now issues with one way streets and directing the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place for me”
Reviews.Author: Lonek
Reviews.Content: I've chosen the hotel for its location, as I needed to stay in the Termini station area. Its major feature is probably the location, within walking distance of everywhere in central Rome, and not far from the metro station. Other than that, the breakfast was thin, the staff not friendly and the elevator small and slow. No free wifi - how lame. The staff was not really rude, they were just not friendly and not helpful and often did not really speak any reasonable English. The problem with the breakfast was that every day I was there something was missing, and half of the plates were empty and remained not replaced. The staff would not notice me, offer coffee or anything, as they were more engaged in their private conversations. The same at the reception desk, they did not seem to pay any attention to the guests waiting there. Not a terrible experience but also nothing special. I would rather not stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good value, very clean”
Reviews.Author: chris48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located - it is a 5 minute walk from bus/metro/train and 10 minute walk from Terravison drop off/pick up bus from Ciampino airport. We found our room very warm and lots of hot water. Towels and sheets were fresh. Although the breakfast is the same each day there are enough choices to devise a new menu each day! Drinks at the bar are very expensive as we found to our expense - 14 euros for 2 shots of grappa - many restaurants will give a shot free if you ask at the end of your meal! This hotel is clean, comfortable and convenient but don't expect staff there to sort your holiday because they won't! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Nats8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Nord at the beginning of our honeymoon on July 12th to the 15th. We didn't know what to expect as we read some mixed reviews. We arrived at around noon, the staff at the front desk were very friendly and checked us in right away. We were also given a map of Rome and the gentleman at the front desk, I unfortunately forgot his name, highlighted all the major places to see and was very helpful. The hotel is in a great location, close to the train station and in walking distance to a lot of places. We walked everywhere in Rome. It only takes 20 to 30 minutes to get to the Colleseum, Piazza Venezia etc, depending on if you stop to look at all the stores, which we did. If you are able to, we highly recommend walking everywhere as you get to see all the little streets in between and the local life. Our room was great, we were on the 3rd floor and had a nice view from our room. The air conditioning worked very well and came in very handy in mid July. Our bathroom was very nice and clean and we always had clean towels. The breakfast was very nice. It definitely isn't like your typical North American breakfast, but then again you are in Italy where breakfast isn't their most important meal of the day. There was different breads, cereals, hard boiled eggs, cheeses and fruit. Great coffee!!!! The roof top terrace is very nice and is great to sit and relax after a day of sightseeing. All in all, this is a great hotel to stay at and we were very pleased with our decision to stay there. It was a great start to our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jeanpierrebentes
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean. Breakfast was good. Staff were friendly and helpfull. My wife and I enjoyed the stay. Jean Pierre

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Meanstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hotel Nord, arriving mid-morning via train from Florence, prior to our return home. Expecting to store our luggage until 3 pm check-in, we were pleasantly surprised when they found us a room right away. The location is excellent, only about four blocks from the Termini (train station, which was an easy jaunt when pulling a big roller bag. We paid $230, and found that to be a great value. The double bed was average, the room clean, and the bath small but adequate. The only amenities we used were the roof top deck for a late-night drink....not much of a view, but a pleasant outside setting. Overall , the hotel staff was friendly.... Once again, the location is a great central spot, easy to get to when you arrive, and perfect for venturing out to see all the sights. The hotel is also two blocks to the subway station (Repubblica). It an easy walk to the Colosseum and the Forum, and other sights are an easy subway ride away. For dinner, our favorite restaurant is Ciao Bella, on the Via Veneto, a half block from the Barberini subway stop (one stop from Repubblica.) Our only complaint is when riding the trains to and from the airport, or between cities in Italy. We're not very computer savy, but we did figure out how to use the automatic ticket machines at the train stations. We ended up saving much time. We also found that first class train travel wasn't worth the extra cost....

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheFriedmans
Reviews.Content: The 3 of us stayed here June 12th-June 15th. The room and washroom were very clean. Breakfast was basic but covered the bases for a decent breakfast. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Location near the Termini station was a plus. Some of the restaurants in the area are reasonable. We would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 3 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, reception staff o.k. but didn`t have much to say, I don`t go on hols to meet them so didn`t bother me, they did their job that`s all I can ask. Location is very good for transport links and in walking distance for most tourist sights. Few bars or retaurants nearby bar next door was o.k. we ate there two evenings and meals acceptable 2 meals plus bottle of wine and a bottle of water about 50 euros. Having stayed in various hotels in europe in recent years I think this is about average and what I would expect. The room and bathroom were very clean, breakfast o.k. but no hot buffet. Roof terrace was very good and a pleasant way to end the day or for a drink before going out . If we visit Rome again I would try to stay somewhere where there is more nightlife nearby. I could recommend this hotel as long s you know you get what you pay for. I booked through Expedia and got the whole package at what I regareded as a " fair price "

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and Roaches!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were booked at the Hotel Nord through a tour agency for 1 night. It was the last night of a 2 week dream vacation before we flew back to the states. And I have to say it was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever encountered. The staff was extremely rude, unhelpful and down right ignorant. And to top it off I turned on the bathroom light in the middle of the night to be greeted by ROACHES running around the floor!!! Needless to say we didn't get a whole lot of sleep on out last night in Italy. It was a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Nord Nuova Roma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A 3 day stay for two seniors from May 5,2006 was totally uneventful. At the 6th floor all was quiet during the evenings as early as 6pm. Seniors being seniors we arrived to breakfast by the 1st 15 minutes of opening. Thereby have no idea if they ran out of most food by 10:30 am closing. Meal includes bread, rolls, sugar doughnuts, yogurt, ham, cheese, juice, coffee, milk along with 3 types of cold cereal along with a bowl full of boiled eggs. We enjoyed 3 of these buffets. At only 3 blocks from termini station we used the E9.5 train to and from their airport. One nilght we walked from the Nord to Trevi Fountain--we think around 3 miles total. We would stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to all in the price range 200+nightly in dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Hotel Nord very much”
Reviews.Author: strathspey
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hotel Nord for 3 nights. Found the hotel spotless and the staff friendly and helpful. Very easy access to the train station. We carried our luggage over there ourselves. A decent walk to nearly everything when armed with a map. which they provide. (15-20minutes to the Colosseum and 45 minutes to the Vatican). We used the WiFi in our room. (22 euros per day... pretty pricey!) We had a king size bed and clean marble bathroom with shower and bidet, no tub. We loved the roof terrace for a drink before dinner. The hotel recommended restaurants and called ahead to tell them we were coming. Breakfast was fine, but no scrambled eggs. Plenty of cereal, pastries, cheese, fruit, juices and coffee. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ”
Reviews.Author: JoJamie
Reviews.Content: We found all the staff to be very cheerful, pleasant and couldn't do enough to help us out. Luca on reception recommended a restaurant whioch he uses. When we got there there was an hours wait for a table but as Luca had sent us we got seated immediately. The hotel has no restaurant but there are millions nearby, Rome is well-known for good eateries and you would be mad to confine yourself to a hotel restaurant anyway. It does have a little roof terrace with a bar which is absoultely beautiful to sit and have wine or coffee and look over the Bascillica of Santa Maria Maggiore. The rooms were very clean and the shower cubicle was huge! The rooms were practical and comfortable. There is also a fitness gym in the hotel if you have the engery to use it. The hotel is near the termini and for a busy city centre hotel is quite quiet. Overall this was one of the best hotels I have stayed in in terms of friendly, helpful staff. They had lots of maps at reception and are happy to point things out for you or order taxis etc. I will certainly be returning to this hotel. We were originally booked into the International Palace hotel in Rome who when we arrived denied all knowledge of a booking and told us the hotel was full. We were placed in the Nord Nuova which we were told was only a 3 star superior compared to the 4 star International. Having seen both hotels I would saythat either the International is a rubbish 4 star or the Nord is a very excellent 3 star. Having seen both I would always pick the Nord over the other one

Reviews.Title: “Good location BUT...”
Reviews.Author: raffael24
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the station Termini, so a lot of busses and the metro are just around the corner. And that's what you're paying I guess. The room was in bad condition. The door to the bathroom couldn't be closed, the window was hard to open, there was no balcony, holes in the walls,... The roof terrace was closed during our whole stay. When we arrived there was still dirt in the bath tub, a toenail was on the floor. Late check out hasn't been possible. Breakfast was good but not a lot to choose from. Rome is a great city but I think there are better/cheaper hotels than this.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: shelleybeandip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 11/25/05-12/2/05. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel, costing 75 euros. We were able to check in early (10:00 am). The hotel was in good condition and nicely decorated. The staff spoke English and provided us with a map. I recommend picking up a map during your stay as it was much more detailed than the maps we brought with us. Our room was small but very clean. The mini bar was a small refrigerator consisting of two bottles of water and two drinking glasses, leaving plenty of room to put our own snacks and drinks inside. The room was nonsmoking, but the floors are not. Therefore we constantly had cigarette smoke in our room. Surprisingly, our room was stifling hot even though the weather outside was cool. The air conditioner did not work, so we had a hot room that smelled of smoke. Opening the windows provided a great breeze, but our room was on the 1st floor and unfortunately right above a very busy and loud city street. The shower drain was clogged. We reported this but it was not fixed during our stay. A 5-minute shower risked flooding the bathroom. The bed was hard as a rock. Normally I like a firm bed, but even I was shocked by how hard it was. We could also hear other guests in their room. We could hear the telephone, conversations, using the restroom, etc. Our room was near the stairway, so we could hear the other guests coming and going. Breakfast was included in our hotel cost. It consisted of pastries, toast, hard-boiled eggs, sliced ham & cheese, frozen yogurt and cereal. The beverages consisted of juices, coffee and tea. Breakfast was served from 6 am to 10 am. Also, the hotel does not have “laundry facilities” as I read in the description on different web site. It has a laundry/dry cleaning/pressing service. The hotel is not far from the Termini. We never took a train, but there is a grocery store there, plus other shops. The metro is also nearby and we used it for some of the tourist attractions a little too far to walk. There is also a nice restaurant next door called Gran Caffee, plus lots of shopping near the hotel. We used the hotel’s transportation service to get back to the airport. It’s 47 euros for up to 3 people.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SDSungirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really great. Very clean, friendly staff, and excellent location. Traveling as a single female, I felt very safe, even walking to/from the hotel and Metro, even at night. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had no idea where to stay in Rome and so after long hours of searching and reading reviews we decided on this hotel as it seemed to be the best in our price range. I would recommend this hotel, the location is fantastic, room size is more than adequate, it is clean, the staff are friendly staff, breakfast is fine and the roof top terrace is lovely. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VR91704
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in Sept. The staff was nice, the rooms were spacey, they provide a map of the city, the only thing I didn't like about our room was that there was no tub to soak my feet in after hours of walking. Other then that, the food was typical/abundant. We ate at a very nice/reasonable ($40euro for 2) restaurant twice around the corner from the hotel "Terme di Diocleziano", great food, wine and staff!!! The hotel is 2 blocks from the trains and bus terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: AdrianKorsner
Reviews.Content: Look no further. It starts with friendly reception staff and has everything you could want. Not overly large rooms but clean, neat and in nice condition. Marvelous breakfast with superb service (even has a maitre de). Terrific 'roof top' bar for drinks after a hard days trips. Nice foyer lounge for relaxing. Great position close to station (easy short walk) which made it easy for airports and saved on rip-off cabs. I could find a few criticisms but it would'nt be fair considering its 3* and so reasonably priced. I wouldn't stay anywhere else if I go again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: gardkarlsen
Reviews.Content: When we decided to go to Rome we looked into booking plane tickets and hotel separately. Eventually, the combination of time constrictions and budget, led to us buying a package deal from Expedia - plane tickets and hotel. We bought a deal that took us from London to Rome flying Alitalia and 5 nights at the Bettoja Hotel Nord Nuova Roma for 720£ (about 1300$), excluding breakfast. As usual, it was not easy to decide which hotel to choose. We did some homework and most reviews indicated that the Termini area was “highly undersirable”. The decision to stay in the area was influenced by price and the fact that there were renowned 4-5 star hotels in the same vicinity – how “undersirable” could the area really be then? On the morning of July 2nd we arrived at the Termini train station using the Leonardo express. The hotel is located in the street Giovanni Amendola so it is only a short walk from the main entrance of the train station. The reception desk area was typical for a smaller European hotel I guess: quite tiny. But the check in was pretty fast and after filling in some papers we got the key to room 544 and took the lift to our room on the 5th floor. The room looked really dark when we came in but it got much lighter when we opened the doors to a small balcony. But we didn’t leave the doors open very long. It was getting quite hot even if it was early morning so it was better to keep them shut and let the air-conditioning do its job. The air-conditioning only seemed to have three settings: high, medium and low and it was a bit noisy…but it was better than nothing :-) The view from the balcony was not spectacular either. The room itself was not that big but had what we needed: a double bed, a little TV on a desk with a few English channels (BBC, CNN etc) and a small safe where we could lock up our valuables. The floor was tiled and the walls had been painted in a yellowish color. This did brighten up the room as it looked somewhat gloomy with the dark furniture. The bathroom was bigger than expected and was nice and light - with light tiles and natural light coming in from a window. There was a bath (with a shower option using a shower curtain), toilet, bidet and a sink. Together with the usual soap, shampoo and shower cap. And there was also a hair dryer on the wall. Tip: If you like hot showers, let someone else shower before you! The water took a while to heat up to Nikki’s liking. According to the information in the hotel it was possible to get access to wireless internet connection but I didn’t bring along my laptop so I never got to try it out. There was also a gym that we never took a look at as we got enough exercise from walking all over Rome every day :-) On the roof top there is a terrace where you can sit, have a drink and enjoy the view of rooftops in Rome. Breakfast was not included in our hotel package and we didn’t eat at the hotel. But there was a nice place to have breakfast on the corner of the hotel (turn left when leaving the hotel) called Nori. They had very good coffee and different sandwiches. Remember that it is cheap if you just have your coffee by the counter. But if you sit down and get the coffee served then the price is higher. I think I paid about 0.7 € for an espresso at the counter. But when we sat down we had to pay about 4.5 € for a cappuccino. Location As mentioned initially the hotel is located a few minutes from the Termini station. This was handy when arriving from the airport and when leaving again :-) It was also handy for getting around Rome. There is a bus station in front of the Termini and we used busses no. 40 and 64 all the time to get around. There is also a metro station at the Termini that can be used but we didn’t really use it that much as the Rome guidebook didn’t have a proper subway map. The Termini area is not that far from the main attractions in Rome. If you walk down Via Cavour I think it only takes about 15 minutes to get to the street where you see Coliseum, Forum etc. There were restaurants in the area around the hotel but we normally ate in places around Piazza Navona. Conclusion We had a nice stay at this 3 star hotel and I wouldn’t hesitate recommending it to others. But as in New York we got just what we expected: a small room where we could spend the night and get a shower after walking around in the heat of Rome all day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by this small pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: nangela
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, very close to the Termini Train station, for our last night stopover in Rome before flying back to New York. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel had pretty decor, was clearly recently renovated, very clean, and adequate. Although the room was small, it had everything one would need. We were sorry that we didn't have more time to stay here and visit Rome again. The location, although, not fancy, was really good. There were plenty of nice restaurants and the access to transportation could not be beat. The staff were extremely friendly, recommending a nice restaurant, as well as arranging our transportation to the airport the next day. We loved this hotel, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with public transportation nearby”
Reviews.Author: Ketone16
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Nord Nuova Roma to be pleasant, but I'll try to describe the accommodations in more detail and let you decide for yourself. My girlfriend and I stayed at the hotel the evenings of 3-5 and 9-10 July 2005. The first room (3-5 July) was nominally a "double", but was actually two twin mattresses pushed together on the same frame. The rates were 105, 115, and 135 euro for Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday nights. We initially had a problem with this room because it had two separate twin beds; because we had already occupied the room before we complained they wouldn't change the bed until the next day. So on Monday we kept the same room but they mounted the two mattresses on one frame. I don't know if this is typical of other "double" rooms in the hotel. In addition to the bed(s) the room had a nightstand, a table with small (old-looking) color TV, a comfortable chair, a large wall-mounted mirror above the table, and a closet (I believe with a chest of drawers inside). There was a small safe in the closet but it didn't come with instructions. The decor seemed plain but nice. The bathroom had a small window and a sink, toilet, and bidet, as well as a bathtub with a wall-mounted showerhead (the shower curtain only encircled half the bathtub). The room was on the side of the hotel and overlooked a small street/alley that had some restaurants (Chinese and other) on it. The room had air conditioning, which was nice (it wasn't too strong but maybe we didn't set it high enough). The second room (9-10 July) was a true double with one large bed; the rate was 105 euro per night for Saturday and Sunday nights. The decor was nicer -- the wood looked fancier, for example. The main differences were that there was no closet although there was a large dresser for clothes (with a safe inside, this time with instructions) and the shower was different: it was a stand-up shower with doors and a detachable hand-held showerhead. It was big enough for two people but just barely. This room had the feature that to enable the lights in the room you had to insert a special key (included with the room key) in a socket near the door. I think this room was more modern that the first room. It also was a smoking room, but that actually was fine once we aired out the room for a while with an open window. (They told us later that the hotel only had six non-smoking rooms and none of them were true doubles; our first room might have been non-smoking.) This room was at the front of the hotel and overlooked a slightly larger and busier street, but the noise wasn't too bad even when the window was open. The air conditioning seemed stronger in this room, but maybe we just set it higher. Interestingly, the doorknob to this room was on the right side of the door and unlocked by turning the key counterclockwise, whereas in the first room the doorknob was on the left and unlocked by turning the key clockwise. The hotel is quite close to the Termini train station (we took the EuroStar high-speed train to Florence from there). The hotel is particularly near the end of the station that houses the bus terminals and the Termini Metro station. It's probably a five minute walk or so. The Repubblica Metro station is about the same distance but the Termini Metro is nice since both Metro lines intersect there. (By the way, if you want to take the bus, you can buy a ticket at the machines at the bus terminals (or any other major bus stop). If you want to get a 75-minute ticket, for example, press the appropriate button on the machine and insert your 1 euro coin and after some time it will print a ticket and drop it into the bin below. When you get on the bus validate the ticket by inserting it arrow-forward and face-down into the yellow machine, where it will print a time stamp. No one actually checked our tickets during any of our rides, however. The exact same tickets can be used for the Metro: just validate them before passing the turnstile.) From the Termini station we took the 40 Express to the Vatican which ends near Castel Sant'Angelo and St. Peter's Square, and we took the 910 to Villa Borghese and the Borghese Gallery. I didn't time the walk to the Rome city center (we were stopping to do sightseeing along the way), but I imagine it's not more than a half-hour walk to most of the historical sites in the center. We didn't seem to find any really good restaurants near the hotel, but our search was rather casual. Apparently the hotel has a patio up on the 7th floor with a bar (open from something like 4 PM to 12:20 AM), but we didn't go up there. There was a computer terminal with high-speed internet access for which the rate was 0.35 euro per minute with a minimum charge of 5.25 euro. There are better rates to be had out Rome's various internet cafes (we eventually found one a 15 minute walk away which charged something like 2 euro for 45 minutes). The hotel also had ads stating that the hotel was set up for wireless internet, but I didn't bring my computer with me and don't know what the rates are. I tried using an international calling card from the hotel to place a call to the United States, but the call to the 1-800 number listed on the card wouldn't go through. I ended up going through an international operator and charging it to my credit card: big mistake. The cost was US$50 for a short phone call -- approximately $10 per minute! We didn't have too much interaction with the staff, but they seemed pleasant (aside from the initial confrontation over the beds in the first room). The desk staff is pretty English-friendly, as is the case in most locations of Rome frequented by tourists. To check into the hotel you'll need to present the passports of everyone staying in the room (this may be due to regulations about foreign visitors registering with the local police) and you give your credit card when you check out. The concierge on our first visit was helpful in suggesting bus lines to get to various locations within the city. The hotel has a breakfast buffet (ends at 10:30 AM; not sure when it starts) which is pretty nice. They have a selection of rolls, croissants, slices of ham and cheese for sandwiches, some packets of butter and jellies, and cereal bins. They have machines that dispense fruit juices (blood orange, grapefruit, and pineapple) and water, and they serve coffee and tea. Overall, except for some glitches I found the hotel to be comfortable and conveniently accessible to a wide range of public transportation. If you want to look up the hotel and surrounding neighborhood on a mapping program (e.g., Google Earth, [--]), its coordinates are approximately 41 deg 54' 03.6" N, 12 deg 29' 51.3" E.
